name: treatment of glass from used cathode ray tube | glass from used cathode ray tube | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5837/documentation

The multioutput-process "treatment CRT glass" delivers the co-products "disposal, treatment of CRT glass”, "glass cullets, panel glass, for CRT glass production, at plant", "glass cullets, funnel glass, for CRT glass production, at plant" and "glass cullets, mixed glass, for CRT glass production, at plant". The allocation is done 100% to the disposal process.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This dataset represents the treatment of CRT tubes. It includes infrastructure, energy consumption, water consumption and an estimation of the efforts for transportation. The process has no emissions to air / water.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from a Swiss CRT glass treatment company - used as global average data.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Modern, up-to-date CRT treatment plant – with crushing, washing and sorting steps.
